item.title: Octopush-ing the limits with style
item.author: Esme Hoston Moore,
item.description: Saturday was the most anticipated day of the underwater hockey calendar: the national tournament. Hosted by a different university each year and run with the assistance of our governing body (the British Octopush Association), the student nationals see the best underwater hockey teams from around …

item.title: Octopush show diving isn’t always bad in sport
item.author: Felix Editor,Esme Hoston Moore,Sam Maser,
item.description: Underwater hockey (or Octopush as it is often called) is a competitive sport combining hockey and snorkelling, played on the bottom of a swimming pool. The rules are similar to hockey, but with shorter sticks (about a foot long), meaning players must dive to the bottom of the pool to flick the …
